result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Jeffery Allen Helene
Current: UNKNOWN ADDRESS,   (Effective: 11-04-2022)
Prior: 1203 21st Ave, Superior, WI 54880 United States
Posted bond funds to cover Burnett County Cases 22GF305, 22CF11, and 21CF174.  No contact with the victim or their residence.  Defendant shall maintain absolute sobriety.
Notice of bail/bond forfeiture returned

11:17 AM Cases 21CF174 and 22CF11 called together.  Defendant Jeffery Allen Helene in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeffery Allen Helene.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. These cases were scheduled for 10/3 (FTA) and 10/5 (FTA).  Atty Chapman updates the Court: was a miscommunication between def and atty.  Def makes a statement.  Court notes forfeiture of bond will stand, to be held for restitution.  Def must post $500 cash by tomorrow 10/7/22 at 3pm.  Warrants are quashed.  Atty Chapman notes agreement contemplates prepaid restitution.  $1,664.29 is the restitution request.  Court will forfeit $500 of the bond, will set aside forfeiture of $700 of the cash bond to hold for restitution.  Def needs to come up with additional funds before cases can resolve.  State argues against forfeiture of the bond, argues for it to forward as restitution.  Court reviews bond statute, makes record, order stands.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.
Plea/sentencing hearing on November 29, 2022 at 10:30 am.

11:34 AM Cases 21CF174 and 22CF11 called together.  Defendant Jeffery Allen Helene not in court.  Attorney Daniel James Chapman in court for Jeffery Allen Helene.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Court makes record, FTA 10-3-22; this is deadline for stayed warrant.  Stay is lifted, warrant is put into place.
Status conference on October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

10:09 AM Cases 21CF174 and 22CF11 called together.  21CF174 was on for status conference; 22CF11 was on for plea/sentencing.  Defendant Jeffery Allen Helene not in court.  Attorney Kevin Thomas Schmidt in court for State of Wisconsin. Atty Daniel Chapman appears on behalf of the defendant, in person.  Atty Chapman indicated the def was unable to prepay restitution and asked about resetting.  Atty Chapman clarifies, believes def is confused.  State requests warrant, forfeiture of bond, and for forfeited bond to be put towards restitution.  Court issues warrant, stays until 10/5/22 at 11:30.  If def does not appear, warrant will be issued and cash will be forfeited to restitution.
Status conference scheduled for October 5, 2022 at 11:30 am.

02:32 PM Called 22CF11 for PH and 21CF174 for STC. Defendant, Jeffery Allen Helene, appeared with Attorney Daniel James Chapman.  Attorney James Jay Rennicke appeared for the State.  All parties appeared in person.  Attny Chapman not appointed on 21CF174, will appear specially today, def will need to contact PD to qualify and get attny appointed.   22CF11 on for Waiver of Preliminary Hearing:  Court informs def of rights to PH; waived by def.  Court finds waiver of right to PH knowingly, freely, voluntarily made.  Court finds factual basis for bind over.  State efiles information which mirrors the complaint.  Case on for Arraignment.  Defendant acknowledges receipt of information, def. waives reading.  Court informs def. of charges, possible penalties and rights.  NG plea entered to all counts.  Bond continues.
